intro: Herpestis monosticta, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of the United States and Canada. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom in the spring. Herpestis monosticta is often found in shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
